{"step_by_step_thinking": "Kabuki syndrome type 1 (KS1) is primarily caused by mutations in the KMT2D gene. However, the question specifically asks about missense variants in exons 38 or 39 of the KMT2D gene. According to Document [10], missense variants in these specific exons of KMT2D cause a multiple malformations syndrome that is distinct from KS1.
